description:
"Sign in with Google" - "coming soon".
Tried to register, was not able to receive their confirmation letter, waited 15 minutes without any result.
Does not work without signing in. Seems to be useless now.
Only works with an account and your data on their server.
summary: Only works with an account and your data on their server

description: I thought I would give this a try despite the negative reviews. Sometimes programs work better after problems have been reported. Not so in this case. The program is not able to run or work in Ubuntu/Kubuntu. I can’t log-in or even sign-up to get the program working. Then it asks me if I want to log-in with my Google account (not really, no one wants to do this) and it shows me the following message “coming soon”. Whats coming soon? A working program? I’m so mad and disgusted with programs like “Pendulums” that do not work. Why are they even listed as a working program when they are not? I have spent countless hours trying to install worthless Linux applications that don’t work. The ones that do, and are good, I have supported monetarily and by leaving honest and positive reviews. The programs that don’t work (and appear to have been abandoned) should be removed so we can stop wasting our time trying install programs that don’t work and are unfinished.

Cette application au design agréable est facile à prendre en main et à utiliser, efficace, conviviale et multi-plateforme. 
Bravo à son concepteur !
